alert.note: Alert for Maries; Miller (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 8:09PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Showers and thunderstorms will develop overnight and repeatedly move over the same areas. An area of 2-4 inches of rain is likely within the watch area with localized amounts to 6 inches. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Benton, Camden, Hickory, Maries, Miller, Morgan and Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Dallas, Laclede and Wright. * WHEN...From Midnight CDT tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
